t: A Psalm of David, when he was in the wilderness of Judah.
O*pn God, you are my God; earnestly I seek you; my*ld soul thirsts for you; my*ln flesh faints for you, as*ld in a dry and weary land where there is no water.
So*ln I have looked upon you in the sanctuary, beholding*ld your power and glory.
Because*ln your steadfast love is better than life, my*ld lips will praise you.
So*ln I will bless you as long as I live; in*ld your name I will lift up my hands.
My*pn soul will be satisfied as with fat and rich food, and*ld my mouth will praise you with joyful lips,
when*ln I remember you upon my bed, and*ld meditate on you in the watches of the night;
for*ln you have been my help, and*ld in the shadow of your wings I will sing for joy.
My*ln soul clings to you; your*ld right hand upholds me.
But*pn those who seek to destroy my life shall*ld go down into the depths of the earth;
they*ln shall be given over to the power of the sword; they*ld shall be a portion for jackals.
But*ln the king shall rejoice in God; all*ld who swear by him shall exult, for*ld the mouths of liars will be stopped.
